revised_title: Electronic Energy Levels of Cyclobutadiene and Benzene: A New Method of Atoms in Molecules
tldr: The authors applied the method of atoms in molecules to calculate the lower excited electronic energy levels of cyclobutadiene and benzene molecules. They compared their results with the ASMO method and found that the new method provided more accurate calculations for these complex molecules. This research contributed to the understanding of molecular structures and electronic properties of conjugated hydrocarbons.
